--- Test For Success ---

Understanding requirements is essential to robust design, so be sure requirements are "SMART":

Specific - and clearly stated

Measurable - including units of measure

Achievable - otherwise its a waste of effort

Relevant - must reflect what customers want

Time-Bound - achievable within project timeframe

Once requirements are understood, the methods for verification shoud be defined. These methods must include specific test procedures to be used, the units of measure, and the acceptance criteria.

There are several categories of testing done in product development.

  • Development Testing Testing done to understand the limits of the design space. To maximize information obtained tests should be designed so that limits are reached about half the time. This way, design constraints are best defined. Sample sizes and test counts need to provide a good statistical basis for
  • Verification Testing Testing done to verify that functional requiremenst are met. Test failures at this point should be rare and carefully evaluated if they occur.
